title: How do self-heating cans work? Are they safe? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes and they've been around for decades. The last time I bought one was on the train from Milan to Brescia in Italy. The self-heating cappuccino had a button on the bottom of the plastic cup that activated the heating system. It's similar to the one used by various militaries around the world in their MRE (Meals Ready to Eat) ration packs. According to Wikipedia, the Flameless Ration Heater was introduced in 1990 and I assume that some time after that it was adopted by civilian industry. Meal, Ready-to-Eat Its an exothermic reaction that creates heat when activated. The most recent iteration I've seen was a self heating cup that contained soup or chowder of some kind at a trade show for the vending industry last year. But the principle can be applied to just about any kind of food that is best (or better) enjoyed while warm or hot.
